most_active_tickets.title: Pieces Desktop not Launching on my Windows PC
Long Term Memory still slows down my PC, even after updating to LTM-2
Filling out Personal Domain in Pieces OS causes gray space to appear

common_issues.title: Pieces OS and Desktop App Issues
common_issues.description: Users report various issues with Pieces OS and Desktop app, including gray space appearing, app not launching, and Ollama integration problems. Troubleshooting steps include restarting apps, reinstalling software, and replacing corrupted folders. Some issues require further investigation from support.

related_issues.title: Filling out Personal Domain in Pieces OS causes gray space to appear
related_issues.text:
Filling out Personal Domain in Pieces OS causes gray space to appear
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When I attempt to fill in the field for personal domain under Pieces OS settings, the moment I start typing an enormous empty gray space appears. 

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3ba417a8-9685-4379-b278-176715101c69
## GitHub Issue Summary: Pieces OS keyboard issue

**Key points raised:**

* DailenG reported an issue with the keyboard not working correctly in Pieces OS.

**Problems identified:**

* The cause of the issue was identified by mack-at-pieces.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* A patch was created and scheduled for release within 24 hours.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue is expected to be resolved with the upcoming patch release.

**Additional resources:**

* Existing Issues: https://github.com/pieces-app/support/issues
* Documentation: https://docs.pieces.app
* YouTube Channel: https://www.youtube.com/@getpieces

**Note:** This conversation occurred in March 2025.

related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop not Launching on my Windows PC
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop not Launching on my Windows PC
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows 11 Home, 24H2

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

My Pieces Desktop application has refused to launch since updating it to the latest version (v4.0.0). It's stuck in the "Ensure Core Dependencies" loading state even though I have Pieces OS already running successfully in the background. Kindly find screenshots below. 

I've tried force quitting both Pieces OS & Pieces Desktop from my Task Manager, uninstalling and re-installing Pieces Desktop, and restarting my PC, all to no avail. Any help would be highly appreciated, thank you!

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/22c14a42-29d6-4a1f-ab34-51ba5074b38e)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/025d2e80-78be-480c-9cc2-a85a440dcf75)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/48c76dde-307a-4451-b85f-0483b74c2321)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* MoyinShabi is experiencing issues connecting Pieces for Developers to Pieces OS.
* There was a recent major update to Pieces OS.
* MoyinShabi didn't receive any notification about a health check.

**Problems Identified:**

* Database issue with MoyinShabi's desktop app ("com.pieces.pfd").
* Unknown issue preventing the app from booting.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* mack-at-pieces suggested downloading and replacing the "com.pieces.pfd" folder with a repaired version.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* MoyinShabi will try the repaired "com.pieces.pfd" folder and report back.

**Additional Notes:**

* MoyinShabi shared log files and the "com.pieces.os_production_Pieces.zip" folder to help with troubleshooting.
* mack-at-pieces identified a bug in the desktop app that could be related to the issue.
* The cause of the inability to boot the app is still unknown.

related_issues.title: Installing Ollama - Forever
related_issues.text:
Installing Ollama - Forever
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/677e938c-3198-4f1b-af00-b22543704fcc)

I have Ollama installed and this is stuck like this forever. I even tried uninstalling Ollama. Still the same :-(
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points raised:**

* User (@waseem852) is unable to use Ollama with Pieces, despite trying various installation methods.
* User has tried installing Ollama through Pieces, manually, and with winget.
* User has uninstalled and reinstalled Ollama, including shutting down Pieces apps and killing them through Task Manager.

**Problems identified:**

* Ollama doesn't work with Pieces, even after multiple installation attempts.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Restarting Pieces OS and Pieces Desktop.
* Uninstalling and reinstalling Ollama.
* Scheduling a call with support to debug the issue.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue was not resolved, even after trying the solutions proposed.
* The user reported the issue still persists even after updating to Pieces 11.2.0.

**Additional notes:**

* The conversation indicates that the user will have a call with support to further investigate the issue.
* The provided timestamps suggest that the issue remains unresolved as of March 4, 2025.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS and Desktop App Issues
common_issues.description: Users are reporting various issues with Pieces OS and Desktop App, including slow performance, high CPU usage, and app launch failures.  Suggested solutions include disabling Long Term Memory, checking for updates, and reinstalling the app. The Pieces team is actively investigating and working on fixes.

related_issues.title: LTM-2 Icons not loading properly
related_issues.text:
LTM-2 Icons not loading properly
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

The LTM Access Control panel has some issues with finding and loading the correct icons for applications:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3385a6b8-3df0-40e3-a4a3-0f20b7625a32)
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key Points Raised:**

* The user, @hra42, reported an issue with missing iconography support for certain applications.
* @mack-at-pieces acknowledged the issue and informed the user about the automatic routing of their issue to the relevant team.
* Additional resources like existing issues, documentation, and YouTube channel were provided.

**Problems Identified:**

* Lack of iconography support for certain applications in Pieces.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* @mack-at-pieces committed to adding support for the applications mentioned by the user.
* Additional resources were provided for users to contribute further information about applications needing icon support.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is acknowledged and assigned to the responsible team.
* Users are encouraged to provide further details about affected applications.
* No solution has been implemented yet, but support for affected applications will be added.

**Overall, the conversation highlights a prompt response from the support team and a clear plan to address the reported issue.

related_issues.title: Long Term Memory still slows down my PC, even after updating to LTM-2
related_issues.text:
Long Term Memory still slows down my PC, even after updating to LTM-2
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Turning on Long Term Memory has been slowing down my desktop computer, even before LTM-2. After updating today, it still happens. It's most noticeable when I use Slack and Discord, and disabling those apps on LTM doesn't work. Even after switching the Processing Mode to Cloud, as suggested by HRA42 on the Discord server, the lag still occurs. At some point, the total CPU usage went up by over 90%.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/eaef0d65-b19b-41f0-bf8a-f143fa8d1e43)

My computer specs:
- CPU: Intel(R) Core(TM) i3-6300 CPU @ 3.80GHz
- RAM: DDR4 32 GB
- Graphics: GeForce GTX 950 2 GB

I'm yet to notice significant slowness on other programs, but if I'm getting a lot of lag on those chat apps, I can imagine I would get them too on something heavier like Visual Studio.
## Summary of GitHub Conversation about Pieces High CPU Usage 

**Key points raised:**

* @epikkoder reported high CPU usage by Pieces OS on Linux Mint 22.1.
* The bot suggested related issues and resources.
* @hra42 confirmed the team is working on a hotfix.

**Problems identified:**

* Pieces OS uses high CPU resources on Linux Mint 22.1.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Team is working on a hotfix.

**Current status/outcome:**

* Hotfix is in progress. No further updates provided.

related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop not Launching on my Windows PC
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop not Launching on my Windows PC
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows 11 Home, 24H2

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

My Pieces Desktop application has refused to launch since updating it to the latest version (v4.0.0). It's stuck in the "Ensure Core Dependencies" loading state even though I have Pieces OS already running successfully in the background. Kindly find screenshots below. 

I've tried force quitting both Pieces OS & Pieces Desktop from my Task Manager, uninstalling and re-installing Pieces Desktop, and restarting my PC, all to no avail. Any help would be highly appreciated, thank you!

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/22c14a42-29d6-4a1f-ab34-51ba5074b38e)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/025d2e80-78be-480c-9cc2-a85a440dcf75)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/48c76dde-307a-4451-b85f-0483b74c2321)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* MoyinShabi is experiencing issues connecting Pieces for Developers to Pieces OS.
* There was a recent major update to Pieces OS.
* MoyinShabi didn't receive any notification about a health check.

**Problems Identified:**

* Database issue with MoyinShabi's desktop app ("com.pieces.pfd").
* Unknown issue preventing the app from booting.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* mack-at-pieces suggested downloading and replacing the "com.pieces.pfd" folder with a repaired version.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* MoyinShabi will try the repaired "com.pieces.pfd" folder and report back.

**Additional Notes:**

* MoyinShabi shared log files and the "com.pieces.os_production_Pieces.zip" folder to help with troubleshooting.
* mack-at-pieces identified a bug in the desktop app that could be related to the issue.
* The cause of the inability to boot the app is still unknown.

recommendations: Investigate and address the root cause of Pieces OS and Desktop App launch failures.
Improve communication with users regarding known issues and workarounds, such as the Ollama integration problems and Long Term Memory performance issues.
Prioritize resolving the gray space appearing issue in Pieces OS, as it affects core functionality.
Optimize Long Term Memory to reduce CPU usage and improve performance, particularly for resource-intensive applications.
Enhance iconography support for various applications within the Pieces ecosystem to improve user experience.
Consider implementing a system for proactively identifying and addressing potential issues before they become widespread, such as the health check suggested by a user.
